Body:
I tried use the touch screen 3.2 inch in my raspberry with android things, but is not working!! I searched a lot, but nothing help me! This is my original config.txt:

kernel=u-boot-dtok.bin<br>	framebuffer_depth=16<br>	dtparam=i2c_arm=on<br>	dtoverlay=pwm-2chan-with-clk,pin=18,func=2,pin2=13,func2=4<br>	dtparam=spi=on<br>	dtparam=audio=on<br>	start_x=1<br>	Tell U-boot to always use the serial0" interface for the console
column9: which is<br>	set to whichever uart (uart0 or uart1) is set to the header pins. This doesn't<br>	interfere with the uart selected for Bluetooth.dtoverlay=chosen-serial0<br>	Enable skip-init on the UART interfaces
column10: so U-Boot doesn't attempt to<br>	re-initialize them.dtoverlay=rpi-uart-skip-init<br>	Uncomment to disable serial port on headers
column11:
use GPIO14 and GPIO15<br> as gpios and to allow the core_freq to change at runtime.enable_uart=1 core_freq=400<br>

This is my raspberry with the touch screen

"

Body: The screen is blank when turn on. The resolution is 320X240.
Do you get any display blinking when the power supply is turned on? Also, can tell the exact display model (preferably providing a link)? And in addition, do you have a `Raspberry Pi 3`?
Can you provide as much the display info as possible?
